column16: Comments
column17: Comments from Friday meeting
column25: Souce

column16: Episurf entered into a highly structured transaction to acquire a diversified mixed-use property portfolio alongside bond assets.
column25: Episurf i trasslig fastighetsaffär för 743 mkr

column16: A third penthouse apartment at the top of Karlatornet has been sold to a foreign buyer - the apartment was listed at 62.5 MSEK. The sale further confirms continued demand for ultra-prime residential units in landmark developments.
column25: Bilder: Tredje penthouset i Karlatornet sålt

column16: A 510 sqm luxury apartment near Strandvägen on Östermalm was sold off market after a short process. The price is undisclosed but described by market sources as exceptionally high, underlining continued strength in Stockholm’s prime residential segment.
column25: Record price near Strandvägen – apartment of 510 sq m

column16: Svenska Handelsfastigheter acquired 16 modern retail properties across Sweden, primarily leased to grocery and discount retailers such as Coop, Willys and Rusta. The portfolio generates annual rental income of SEK 111m and significantly strengthens SHF’s national retail platform.
column25: Buys 70,000 sq m of retail space for SEK 1.6 billion

column16: The residential project Ersta/25 on Södermalm is fully sold and occupied. The project comprises 25 apartments and achieved an average sales price of 157,000 SEK per sqm, with the penthouse previously sold at 284,000 SEK per sqm.
column25: Projects sold for an average of 157,000 SEK/sq m in Södermalm

column16: Vacse acquired a development property in Solna to be refurbished and adapted for a judicial authority. The total investment, including project costs, is estimated at approximately SEK 650m. The asset is believed to be located near E4 in northern Solna, with Catella advising the seller.
column25: Vacse invests SEK 650 million in Solna

column16: Kunskapsporten is developing a new indoor swimming and wellness facility in Skurup under a turnkey contract with Peab. The project expands the municipality’s sports infrastructure and is scheduled for completion in 2028.
column25: Kunskapsporten invests in a swimming pool in Skurup

column16: Nivika acquired a fully let light industrial property in Helsingborg leased to Ahlsell on a remaining lease term of around five years. The transaction marks Nivika’s return to Helsingborg and strengthens its presence in southern Sweden.
column25: Nivika buys a house with Ahlsell in Helsingborg

column16: Safjället Fastigheter acquired an office property in Gårda from Folksam, consolidating ownership of a connected building block in the area. The acquisition enables a more holistic development strategy for the block and strengthens Safjället’s position in Gårda.
column25: PG Persson strikes with new purchase in Gothenburg

column16: Intea acquired the new Ångermanland District Court, currently under completion, fully leased to the Swedish Courts Administration on a 15-year lease. The property combines a historic renovation with new construction and strengthens Intea’s public property presence in Härnösand.
column25: Intea acquires new district court

column16: Emilshus acquired 14 fully let properties across Sweden in eight transactions, primarily within light industrial, with nine assets located in Malmö. The portfolio is leased to established tenants such as Sonepar, Peab and Alcro and enhances Emilshus’ cash flow and geographic diversification.
column25: Emilshus strikes with purchase of nine houses in Malmö

column16: Castellum divested seven non-core properties across Sweden and Denmark with elevated vacancy levels as part of portfolio optimization. The assets span office, retail, industrial and hotel use and are sold to improve overall return on equity and capital efficiency.
column25: Castellum sells seven vacant properties for SEK 500 million

column16: Logistea acquired three fully let industrial and logistics properties via share deals. The assets are leased to Bama Foods, Arnessons Betongborrning, Maskin Väst and several smaller tenants, with an average remaining lease term of approximately 6.5 years.
column25: Logistea buys three 10,000 sq m buildings for SEK 138 million

column16: Anguli acquired three fully leased industrial properties in Trollhättan, establishing a new presence in the city. The assets house industrial tenants including Mimsafe, Westcoast Windows and Ultramare and strengthen Anguli’s footprint in the Trestad area.
column25: Offensive Anguli buys

column16: Intea acquired a police property near Växjö Airport fully leased to the Swedish Police Authority until 2036. The property includes additional development rights of approximately 6,000 sqm, with an option for the tenant to expand through new construction.
column25: Intea buys police building

column16: Diös acquired a centrally located office property adjacent to the central station in Sundsvall with strong occupancy and an eight-year lease to Sundsvall Energi. The asset also benefits from an ongoing detailed zoning plan that creates future development potential.
column25: Diös in double smaller deals – keeps prices secret

column16: Diös divested a mixed-use property located outside central Luleå as part of its portfolio optimization strategy. The sale allows Diös to reallocate capital toward assets and locations where it sees higher long-term value creation potential.
column25: Diös in double smaller deals – keeps prices secret

column16: Sehlhall acquired land in Solbacka with the intention to develop a new care home and group housing as part of Norrtälje’s long-term elderly care strategy. The project is planned to start construction in late 2026 and will be certified according to Miljöbyggnad Silver.
column25: Sehlhall buys land for nursing home in Norrtälje

column16: Corem divested five properties across Sweden and Denmark in four separate transactions to support geographic focus and capital reallocation. The assets span office, warehouse and care uses, with Järngrinden acquiring the Mölnlycke property to strengthen its local presence.
column25: Corem sells for SEK 300 million

column16: John Mattson sold a vacant office property with an approved zoning plan for residential development to Patriam, enabling approximately 28 new apartments in a waterfront location in Finnboda.
column25: John Mattson säljer till Patriam i Nacka

column16: Logistea acquired two fully leased logistics and light industrial properties in Uddevalla and Trollhättan through share deals, with strong tenants in food wholesale and industrial technology. The transaction strengthens Logistea’s regional portfolio with stable cash flow and limited operational responsibility for the owner.
column25: Logistea köper i Uddevalla och Trollhättan

column16: Frentab Fastigheter acquired two leasehold industrial properties in Lunda and Högdalen, strengthening its presence in established Stockholm industrial submarkets. The assets will be actively managed and selectively renovated to support long-term demand from construction and production tenants.
column25: Frentab köper i Lunda och Högdalen

column16: Hemsö divested a mixed-use care-oriented property near Tullinge station to Revelop as part of its portfolio consolidation strategy. The transaction enables Hemsö to reallocate capital toward new investments in sustainable social infrastructure.
column25: Hemsö säljer till Revelop i Tullinge

column16: Skanska is investing in the final development phase of the Närheten residential project in Kungsängen, completing a long-term development in the area. The project comprises owner-occupied apartments with strong sustainability credentials and is scheduled for completion in 2027.
column25: Skanska investerar 250 mkr i flerbostadshus i Uppsala

column16: Prisma Properties has secured a long-term lease with Lidl for a new grocery store at a strategic entry point to Simrishamn, subject to planning approval. The project strengthens Prisma’s presence in southern Sweden and aligns with its focus on discount food retail.
column25: Prisma och Lidl satsar i Simrishamn

column16: Lansa divested a small, vacant property in Växjö as part of its ongoing portfolio optimisation strategy. The buyer is a local investor planning to redevelop the asset based on future market needs.
column25: Lansa säljer litet och tomställt i Växjö

column16: Gillesvik sold a small, centrally located property in Gamla Stan following a completed renovation cycle. The transaction reflects continued liquidity and pricing strength for high-quality assets in Stockholm’s historic core.
column25: Affär mitt i Gamla stan

column16: Trophi acquired two grocery-anchored properties in Karlshamn through a sale-and-leaseback with Coop, securing long-term leases with a dominant food retail income share. The transaction strengthens Trophi’s daily-goods portfolio with stable cash flows and strong tenant covenants.
column25: Trophi acquires two from Coop for SEK 110 million

column16: Sveafastigheter and KlaraBo executed a large-scale residential portfolio swap to improve management efficiency and geographic focus. The transaction optimises both companies’ portfolios by reinforcing core clusters while divesting non-strategic locations. The swap expands SF’s presence in Jönköping, Umeå, Falun, Borlänge, Höganäs, Oskarshamn, while exiting Malmö, Sundsvall, Östersund, Trelleborg, Motala.
column25: Sveafastigheter in exchange deal worth SEK 2.1 billion

column16: Fondamentor divested two long-held properties in Röbäcksdalen following more than a decade of active asset management and upgrades. The sale marks a natural exit after value creation with stable public-sector and corporate tenants.
column25: Fondamentor i mindre försäljning i Umeå

column16: Vacse acquired a fully refurbished education property used for police training and leased long-term to the University of Borås. The acquisition complements Vacse’s portfolio of specialised public-sector properties with stable, government-related income.
column25: Vasce köper fastighet för polisutbildning

column16: FlexFast strengthened its Stockholm presence by acquiring a city-near industrial leasehold in the established Lunda area. The asset fits the company’s strategy of owning and developing flexible light industrial properties with long-term value potential.
column25: FlexFast gör mindre förvärv i Spånga

column16: Trophi acquired a centrally located grocery-anchored property in Linköping with Hemköp as tenant and an adjacent garage. The deal strengthens Trophi’s presence in the city with a daily-goods asset offering stable cash flow and strong accessibility.
column25: Trophi förvärvar i centrala Linköping

column16: Hagabacken completed 28 acquisitions across light industrial, warehouse, office and social infrastructure assets during Q4. The investments focus on cash-flow-generating properties in strong micro-locations and lift the total portfolio value above SEK 4 billion.
column25: Hagabacken köpt för 1 mdr – når totalt 4 mdr

column16: Lerstenen and Selbergs acquired large, zoned development rights in central Umeå with plans for approximately 300 homes and complementary retail. The transaction aligns with both parties’ strategies to expand long-term residential development through well-located projects.
column25: Duo köper byggrätter för 300 bostäder i Umeå

column16: Trianon continued its expansion in Sofielund through the acquisition of eight residential properties, adding 170 apartments to its local portfolio. Trianon has thus purchased for SEK 428 million in Sofielund in the last couple of days. The deal increases operational efficiency and reinforces Trianon’s long-term commitment to housing-led urban development in Malmö.
column25: Trianon förvärvar ytterligare åtta i Sofielund

column16: Hedern strengthened its position in Örnsköldsvik’s city centre by acquiring a landmark banking property and a centrally located parking site with residential development potential. The transaction supports Hedern’s strategy of long-term ownership and city-centre densification.
column25: Hedern fortsätter köpa i Örnsköldsviks stadskärna

column16: Nordiqus entered Enköping through a forward commitment acquisition of a new F–9 school with a long-term lease to Jensen Education. The transaction strengthens Nordiqus’ education infrastructure portfolio with a modern, sustainability-certified asset in a growing residential area.
column25: Nordiqus acquires school project in Enköping

column16: Trianon acquired ten centrally located residential properties in Sofielund, significantly strengthening its Malmö-focused housing portfolio. The assets offer clear long-term value creation potential and contribute positively to earnings through stable rental income.
column25: Trianon buys for SEK 240 million

column16: The City of Stockholm agreed to repurchase approximately 1,200 rental apartments in Hjulsta through its municipal housing company Familjebostäder. The transaction is politically significant and reinforces public ownership of rental housing without affecting existing tenant contracts.
column25: Einar Mattsson closes deal with billion-dollar deal in Hjulsta

column16: Neobo divested a non-core industrial asset in Norrköping as part of its ongoing portfolio optimization strategy. The sale frees up capital to be redeployed into residential investments within the company’s core focus areas.
column25: Neobo sells industrial property in Norrköping

column16: Southbay completed its sixth investment with the acquisition of a newly completed logistics asset featuring a strong anchor tenant and leasing upside. The transaction marks a geographic expansion and strengthens Southbay’s modern, sustainability-focused logistics portfolio.
column25: Southbay's sixth investment – ​​buying from Slättö

column16: Genova acquired a majority stake in a joint venture controlling a former industrial site earmarked for residential development in Ekerö centrum. The investment aligns with Genova’s strategy of early-stage urban development to create long-term value through new zoning.
column25: Buying a large dilapidated property in a future location

column16: The tenant-owned housing association Brf Rackelhanen 2 acquired its property on Östermalm through a right of first refusal from SH Pension. The transaction converts the building into tenant ownership and was financed via Ålandsbanken.
column25: Brf completes purchase for SEK 217 million in Östermalm

column16: Alecta Fastigheter acquired the landmark Hasseln 1 property, formerly housing Casino Cosmopol, in a strategic inner-city location. The asset will be repositioned into high-quality offices and event space as part of Alecta’s broader Västra City strategy.
column25: Buying the casino house in the city

column16: Vaultica opened its largest Nordic data center facility in Upplands Väsby, strengthening its European platform backed by Apollo Funds. The facility supports high-capacity enterprise and cloud clients with a strong focus on security, scalability and renewable energy use.
column25: Vaultica invests in data centers in the 08 area

column16: NP3 acquired 12 fully leased retail and industrial properties across several cities in its core Mid Sweden market through three transactions. The acquisitions support NP3’s continued portfolio expansion, with long average lease terms and full occupancy.
column25: NP3 buys for 442 million

column16: Muro Fastigheter acquired two modern office and warehouse properties in the A6 area of Jönköping under a long 15-year lease to the seller. The transaction strengthens Muro’s presence in a strategically important logistics and commercial location.
column25: Muro Fastigheter buys two in Jönköping

column16: Uppsala Municipality completed several land sales to residential developers for apartment buildings, townhouses and small houses in multiple growth areas. The transactions support the municipality’s long-term housing supply goals.
column25: Uppsala Municipality sells land to four investors

column16: Areim acquired a portfolio of nine warehouse and light industrial properties located close to the E4 in Linköping. The assets are largely leased and strengthen Areim’s presence in regional growth cities following its recent expansion to Norrköping.
column25: Areim grows in light industry – buys 20,000 sq m

column16: Akademiska Hus is investing in a full renovation of the Zoologen building to create modern laboratory and office space within the Medicinareberget life science cluster. The project aims to support collaboration between academia, healthcare and private life science companies.
column25: AH invests SEK 245 million in life science cluster

column16: Bonava acquired a development site in Rosendal where it plans to build around 60 climate-positive wooden apartments. The project supports Uppsala’s ambition to create one of Sweden’s most sustainable and low-carbon urban districts.
column25: Bonava acquires in southern Uppsala

column16: 94% leased to mixed tenants; strategic E4 location. Areim expands to Linköping; portfolio now ~90 assets, 380,000 m². NIY of 7%.
column17: 12000 ppsqm
column25: Areim växer inom lättindustri – köper 20.000 kvm

column16: Partially paid via seller notes and cash. Lejons Mäkleri has acted as advisor in the deal.
column25: Tingsvalvet acquires Örebo for SEK 100 million

column16: Resona and Hines have signed an agreement on a forward funding deal becoming one of Sweden’s largest 2025 housing projects; Price estimated at ~1,000 MSEK. 309 units with estimated NOI of 51.7 MSEK.
column17: yield beloow 5%, around 4.9%
column25: Hines in new large housing deal in the 08 area

column16: NOI ~16.5 MSEK; strengthens Stendörren’s Uppsala presence
column25: Stendörren buys for a quarter of a billion in Uppsala

column16: 6 residential properties acquired in two transactions; strengthens Arum’s portfolio in Mälardalen.
column25: Arum acquires in Nyköping and Eskilstuna

column16: Two transactions: 132 units in Höganäs + 91 units in Sigtuna (total 223 units). Some properties under construction (2027 completion).
column25: Urban Partners and Granitor in JV – buys 223 homes

column16: Västervik Stadshotell (Best Western); 101 rooms; strengthens Slottsholmen’s regional presence.
column25: Björn Ulvaeus buys city hotel

column16: Property Motorn 1, 2,800 m², sold vacant. Includes workshop, dealership/store and offices.
column25: Atteviksgruppen sells in Älmhult

column16: Two properties (Röbäcksdalen 1:8 & 1:9). Tenants: Umeå kommun & Toontrack. Fully renovated over 10+ years.
column25: Fondamentor sells two in Umeå

column16: Strategic light-industrial asset (Götet 2). Fully let to three tenants.
column25: Nordnäs has sold to Norrman & Son in Västerås

column16: Acquisition of building right “Kista Äng kv. 7 (Hattarvik)”. 270 rental apartments + retail + garage. Will be certified Miljöbyggnad Silver. H2 building four major Kista Äng projects (total ~1,000 apts).
column25: Hanssons Hus köper ytterligare i Kista äng

column16: Cybele 12, Stora Nygatan 35 / Tyska Brinken 30. 750 m² office + retail. First Gamla stan acquisition for Centria. Cushman & Wakefield advisor. Building constructed 1636–1651.
column25: Köper i Gamla stan

column16: Two adjacent properties west of E18. Mixed tenants incl. national energy company and construction firm with long leases. Active sees development potential.
column25: Active köper två fastigheter i Vallentuna

column16: Four assets: Elektrikern 1–2, Muraren 4–5. Fully let (Ahlsell, HLL, etc). 14,000 m² land area. Strategic port-adjacent location. Tenzing expanding in light-industrial/logistics.
column25: Tenzing förvärvar fyra nära hamnen i Nynäshamn

column16: Modern 2009-built 47-unit residential asset. Lansa to add solar PV + Miljöbyggnad iDrift certification. Cushman & Wakefield advisor. Strong growth area near Delsjön + public transit.
column25: Lansa köper bostadsfastighet i Göteborg

column16: Divestment of Neobo’s only Södertälje asset. 25% economic vacancy. 3,550 m² commercial + some residential. Sold 6% below external valuation. Lowers Neobo vacancy by ~2 pp. Buyer: Nyckeludden (Ludvig Rosén & RoosGruppen).
column25: Neobo säljer i Södertälje och sänker vakansgraden

column16: 284 new rental units + commercial ground floor + 2 garages. 8,000 + 9,900 m². Strong sustainability profile. Third acquisition for Acer → portfolio now 898 units (SEK 2.5bn invested). Yield of 4.57%.
column25: Acer Bostad förvärvar två nyproducerade för 875 mkr

column16: Acquisition of 381 rental units (212 Sigtuna + 169 Lund). Part of Folksam’s expanding housing strategy. CBRE IM selling from a separate structure. Strong sustainability profile and long-term institutional ownership.
column25: Köper 380 bostäder av CBRE IM

column16: Includes 735 m² office. Built 2001. EQT continues to divest pieces of Svenska Verksamhetsfastigheter.
column25: EQT säljer 10.000 kvm till Ica Fastigheter

column16: 3 preschools + 1 LSS home. Avg WALT ~11 yrs. Strengthens Kinland’s Nordic social infrastructure portfolio to 376 assets. Newsec advisor.
column25: Kinland förvärvar fyra i Norrtälje

column16: EQT sells 33 industrial/logistics assets from Svenska Verksamhetsfastigheter. Portfolio spans Stockholm region, Uppsala, Västerås, Örebro, Eskilstuna, Linköping & Norrköping. Broadgate continues as operating partner. Significant value-add executed under EQT ownership. Marks sale of ~half the SVF portfolio. Yield of 6.7%
column25: EQT säljer blågul portfölj om 33 fastigheter

column16: Strategic expansion of JSR in Stockholm region. Atracco establishes operations on site for circular auto dismantling & logistics. Part of JSR’s long-term industrial strategy.
column25: JSR Fastigheter köper i Västerhaninge

column16: Sale-leaseback of four terminals. Malmö asset largest at 25,000 m². Triple-net leases. NOI 78 MSEK. Total land 330,000 m² → high redevelopment potential. Part of SLP’s record 4.1 BSEK acquisition year.
column25: SLP köper för 1,1 mdr

column16: Train Alliance acquires Nya Fastighets AB Varvsudden incl. 13 properties (71,000 m² buildings + 130,000 m² land). Annual NOI: 38 SEKm. Intends to connect harbour to national rail and integrate area into European TEN-T logistics corridor. Financing via property loan + 100 SEKm bridge loan; plans to bring in co-owners.
column25: Niam säljer i Skåne för 485 mkr

column16: Lynea acquires two projects from Eksjöhus Bostad to jointly develop 80 new environmentally certified rental townhouses. High-standard two-storey homes with Nordic Ecolabel certification. Construction ongoing; occupancy expected Q2 2026 (Bålsta) and Q4 2026 (Riksten). Lynea now has 180 rental townhouses under production since its October 2025 launch.
column25: New Lynea expands with 08 acquisition

column16: SHF acquires the entire Solberga retail centre comprising three fully let properties with 16 tenants including Willys, Jysk, Coop, Lidl, Dollarstore, Rusta and more. Includes new Jula building under construction. One of Mälardalen’s strongest retail nodes.
column25: SHF strikes and buys 27,000 sq m of retail space

column16: Tingsvalvet acquires fully let commercial property generating 7.9 MSEK in annual rent, at a yield slightly above 7.3%. Located near Munktellstaden, part of an ongoing urban transformation area.
column25: Tingsvalvet buys for SEK 100 million – expands in Eskilstuna

column16: Clas Ohlson invests 400–450 MSEK into expanding and automating its major distribution centre in Insjön. Includes 4,600 m² extension, upgraded automation, and future high-bay warehouse expansion. Capacity increases 15–20%.
column25: Clas Ohlson invests half a billion in Insjön

column16: Lund Cathedral sells its second building right in the Råängen project to Sundprojekt, which will develop ~5,000 m² BTA of condominiums with Esencial as architect and NBI Bygg as contractor. Construction expected 2027 with completion 2029.
column25: Lund Cathedral sells land – again

column16: Bonäsudden acquires two newly built residential properties (318 units) totaling 21,600 m². Properties completed 2022–2023 with annual rent of ~40 MSEK. Deal structured as share transfer via apportemission, doubling Bonäsudden’s portfolio.
column25: Municipality makes odd purchase of disputed district court

column16: Municipality acquires courthouse property housing Södertälje Tingsrätt. Short lease expiring 2027 and possible relocation ahead. Asset considered strategically important for central redevelopment.
column25: Bonäsudden buys for 676 million

column16: Sveafastigheter sells 11 properties with 179 units in Horndal, where approx. half the apartments are vacant. Price is undisclosed but believed to be low due to negative NOI. Buyer Mats Eriksson sees potential through heavy refurbishment to attract tenants in the small community.
column25: Mats köpte 170 lägenheter i Horndal: ”Stor utmaning”

column16: Reliwe acquires major residential building rights of ~24,000 m² BTA in central Orminge. Property will be vacant at takeover and forms an important part of the ongoing urban redevelopment of Orminge Centrum.
column25: Coeli säljer till Reliwe

column16: Nivika acquires a fully let 1,400 m² industrial property with 1.4 MSEK annual rent. Acquisition strengthens the company’s presence on the west coast and contributes immediately to operating income.
column25: Nivika köper i Varberg

column16: SPG acquires four LSS care properties with 15-year leases, all to be certified Miljöbyggnad Silver. Deal strengthens SPG’s social infrastructure portfolio with stable long-term tenants.
column25: SPG förvärvar fyra LSS-hus – ökar inom segmentet

column16: Top-floor Karlatornet penthouse (365 m²) sold again; previously owned by Ola Serneke. Strong buyer interest following media exposure; buyer is a Swedish individual with international presence.
column25: Toppvåning i Karlatornet såld igen – Ola Serneke lämnat

column16: Acrinova acquires a 1,550 m² fully let industrial property via sale–leaseback. The site has strong logistics exposure and stable cash flow through long-term tenant Golv & Kakel Bernt Lövkvist AB.
column25: Acrinova gör liten affär i Malmö

column16: SBB sells its entire social infrastructure portfolio—approximately 740 properties across the Nordics—to Norwegian Public Property Invest ASA (PPI) for SEK 32 billion. The deal significantly reduces SBB’s leverage and makes PPI the leading listed social infrastructure company in Europe.
column25: SBB in mega transaction for 32 billion

column16: Barings Real Estate and Innovation Properties form a JV to develop 262 apartments across nine buildings in central Åkersberga, totaling 12,500 m². The Miljöbyggnad Silver–certified project starts Q4 2025 with phased completion between 2027–2028.
column25: Barings buys project with 262 apartments in Åkersberga

column16: NP3 Fastigheter acquires 10 retail properties in central Sweden for SEK 203 million. Eight properties are sold by Coop Värmland and mainly consist of grocery stores totaling 31,400 m² with 93% occupancy and an average lease term of 9.8 years.
column25: NP3 in new Coop purchase

column16: Folksamgruppen acquires a residential project in Vellinge from Peab for SEK 260 million, comprising 102 rental apartments with 6,020 m² of lettable area. The property will be built by Peab and certified Miljöbyggnad Silver, with completion expected around 2027/2028.
column25: Folksam buys rental apartments for SEK 260 million

column16: Lundbergs Fastigheter purchases the property Överfarten 1 in Jönköping’s Skeppsbron district from SMUAB. The 4,000 m² site will be developed into rental housing in line with the city’s urban expansion plans, with construction expected to start in 2026.
column25: Lundbergs is expanding in Jönköping

column16: Stendörren Fastigheter acquires the light industrial property Fyrislund 11:4 in Uppsala for SEK 47 million. The 2,150 m² property, completed in 2025, is fully leased to two tenants and contributes positively to Stendörren’s growing portfolio in Fyrislund.
column25: Stendörren acquires in Uppsala

column16: Tvättbjörnen Fastigheter acquires the property Gävle Mackmyra 20:18 from Genova for SEK 68 million. The fully let property, housing gym and padel facilities, generates about SEK 5 million in annual rent with seven years remaining lease term.
column25: Raccoon buys from Genova in Gävle

column16: K-Fastigheter acquires building rights in Gothenburg’s Björlanda area and forms a joint venture with Alhem Fastigheter to develop around 260 rental apartments and commercial space totaling 16,265 m². The project, valued at SEK 71.5 million, has approved zoning and building permits.
column25: K-Fastigheter buys in Gothenburg – and is included in the joint venture

column16: Titania acquires part of the property Drakskeppet in Huddinge from Huge Bostäder to develop over 500 new homes near Masmo metro station. The project includes student and youth housing and is part of the urban development of Vårby Haga.
column25: Titania acquires Masmo for development of 500 homes

column16: Danish investor Viga Cap acquires a residential portfolio from K-Fastigheter comprising 681 apartments (264 completed, 417 under construction) across Gothenburg, Ale, and Vänersborg for SEK 1.888 billion. The deal marks Viga’s first acquisition in Sweden and includes a joint management venture with K-Fastigheter.
column25: New player makes blue-yellow debut with billion-dollar purchase

column16: Vendus acquires six retail properties in Mora and Stenungsund from Arwidsro for SEK 272.5 million. The portfolio totals 15,000 m² with major tenants including Willys, STC, and Stenungsund Municipality. The transaction strengthens Vendus’ position in grocery-anchored retail.
column25: Vendus buys from Arwidsro for SEK 272 million

column16: Logistea acquires the Mursleven 8 property in Karlskrona for SEK 113 million. The 3,500 m² property, fully leased to Connect Bus on a long-term contract, serves as a bus depot with workshop, offices, and EV charging infrastructure supporting electric bus operations.
column25: Logistea acquires for SEK 110 million in Karlskrona

column4: Acer Bostad (Ontario Teachers’ Pension Plan & Gordion JV)
column16: Acer Bostad acquires 188 rental apartments totaling 6,761 m² from SPG in Tyresö Centrum for SEK 443.5 million. The fully let property holds Miljöbyggnad Gold certification and energy class A, marking one of the highest SEK/m² residential transactions in 2025.
column25: New Acer Bostad buys new property for SEK 450 million from SPG

column16: Areim acquires nine warehouse and light industrial properties in Västerås totaling 17,000 m². The assets, located in Hälla, Erikslund, and Bäckby, are 95% let and will be upgraded for energy efficiency and sustainability.
column25: Areim buys 17,000 sq m

column16: Logistri signs a forward funding agreement to acquire two properties in Ludvika where a 103,000 m² logistics facility will be built for Hitachi Energy. The agreed property value is SEK 1.254 billion with completion expected in early 2027 and a 15-year lease in place.
column25: Done: Logistics reaches goal with energy-filled billion-dollar deal

column16: Ikea opens a 120 m² “Plan and Order” store in Galleria Trädgården in Varberg. The establishment strengthens the city center’s retail offer and is set to open in early 2026.
column25: Ikea invests in Varberg

column16: Hökerum Fastigheter acquires 81 rental apartments in the Sergeanten project in Regementsstaden, Borås, from Peab Bostad. The acquisition supports the company’s local expansion and long-term growth strategy.
column25: Hökerum buys from Peab

column16: Lansa Fastigheter acquires the properties Kooperatören 1–4 in Karlstad, comprising 60 apartments built in 2015. The acquisition strengthens the company’s presence in the city and aligns with its long-term growth objectives.
column25: Lansa acquires 60 apartments in Karlstad

column16: Stenhus sold Kardanen 13, a mostly vacant retail/light industrial property in Örebro, to G&K Blanks Fastigheter for SEK 148M. Sale aligns with Stenhus’ goal to strengthen liquidity and improve occupancy. G&K Blanks continues expanding retail and hotel holdings.
column25: Stenhus sells vacancy for SEK 148 million

column16: Nyfosa sold the retail property Bladbaggen 1 in Hälla, Västerås to Lantmännen Fastigheter for SEK 297M. 91% let, annual rent SEK 25M.
column25: Nyfosa sells trading for SEK 300 million – surprising buyer

column16: Bonnier Fastigheter acquired Ultuna 16:4 (Syrénbersån) from Besqab for SEK 294M. The project includes 137 fully leased rental apartments in Ultuna Trädgårdsstad. Yield of 5.25%. Aligns with Bonniers strategy to grow in housing; first residential asset in Uppsala.
column25: Bonnier acquires Besqab for SEK 300 million

column5: Rialto Properties AB, VerVal AB & Marcus & Son AB
column16: Nivika acquired five properties (Borret 2, Bussen 3, Ekobilen 4 & 8, Macken 1) in Falkenberg totaling 12,400 m² for SEK 225M. Fully leased, annual rent SEK 16.3M. Yield of 7.24%. Funded via equity, loans & B-share transfer (212,766 shares). Strengthens position along Sweden’s west coast.
column25: Nivika buys for SEK 225 million

column16: Trianon sold Kåsören 1 in Malmö to newly formed TriCof Fastighets AB, its JV with Greencarrier’s CoForma Property, for SEK 64M. Planned for 114 tenant-owned apartments in Norra Sorgenfri. Immediate access; marks start of long-term JV collaboration.
column25: Trianon in joint venture with Greencarrier for 114 homes

column16: Corem sold six office properties in Täby totaling 21,000 m² to an undisclosed buyer for SEK 250M. The portfolio had ~25% vacancy, above Corem’s average, thus opting for divestment. Novier acted as advisor. Disposal reduces exposure in Täby; 9 properties remain post-sale.
column25: Corem sold vacancies for SEK 250 million

column16: Logistri acquired Tranås Traktorn 2 & 6 (13,150 m²) from Strömsholmen AB in a sale-and-leaseback deal. 20-year triple-net lease, annual rent SEK 6.7M, land area 33,443 m². Fully leased manufacturing and R&D properties.
column25: Logistri buys two in Tranås

column16: Blooc acquired building rights for 63 rowhouses in Bro Mälarstad from Heimstaden & Magnolia. Building permits approved; construction starting soon. Adds to Blooc’s 220 rights acquired in past year (Sigtuna, Upplands-Bro, Botkyrka). Continues small-house expansion strategy with Derome as development partner.
column25: Blooc buys building rights from Heimstaden and Magnolia in Bro

column16: Prisma Properties acquired two ICA Maxi properties in Arvika (Fälgkorset 2) and Mariestad (Leksberg 10:1) from Kynningsrud via forward funding for SEK 345M. Fully leased to ICA Sverige AB under 15-year leases with annual rent of SEK 21M. Completion: Feb 2026 (Arvika) & Mar 2027 (Mariestad). Yield of 5.75%.
column25: Prisma buys for SEK 345 million

column16: Carl Ek Fastigheter acquired five new residential projects (approx. 140 homes) in Nacka, Täby, and Sollentuna: Hasselbacken (30), Näsbyviken (14), Väsjöbacken (14), Telegrafterrassen (35), and Ekbacken (30). Also expanded Baggensfjärdshöjden project by 14 homes. Strengthens its sustainable small-house development portfolio.
column25: Carl Ek purchased five properties – expanding with 140 homes

column16: Stendörren Fastigheter acquired four light industrial properties – Dragstiftet 3, Passaren 2 (Täby) and Vik 1:70, Vik 1:77 (Upplands Väsby) – from Serafim for SEK 97M. Total lettable area 4,200 m², NOI ~SEK 6.1M. Fully leased to four tenants. Closing: 1 Dec 2025.
column25: Stendörren buys four in the 08 area for SEK 100 million

column16: Genova acquired 5 properties in Greater Stockholm from Landia for SEK 634M, plus a LOI for 3 more properties (~SEK 600M). Mix of life science labs, preschools, hotel, and baroque castle (Noors Slott). Portfolio is 99% leased, yield ~6%, annual rent SEK 38M.
column25: Genova buys for 1.2 billion SEK – castle and vaccine house included

column16: Pionjären Fastighets AB acquired Sundsgården 4, a 12,000 m² community property in Luleå, from Rikshem. Fully leased to Luleå municipality. Strengthens Pionjären’s regional presence in Norrbotten. No plans for change of use.
column25: Pioneer buys from Rikshem in Luleå

column16: Ica Fastigheter acquired Tankbilen 3 in Trelleborg from Svenska Verksamhetsfastigheter. The site covers 42,000 m² with 10,000 m² lettable area. The deal supports Ica’s strategy to secure key logistics and retail properties.
column25: Ica Fastigheter buys property for SEK 88.5 million

column16: The Riksdag Administration bought Havssvalget 5, Artillerigatan 18, from Lars Edman for SEK 300M. Fully vacant residential building (36 apartments, 1,950 m²) acquired for Members of Parliament accommodation.
column25: Going for 300 million near Östermalmstorg

column16: Roccia Fastigheter acquired Nälsögat 6, a 4,100 m² retail property in Eskilstuna from a private seller. Tenant: Willys (Dagab Group) on a long-term lease. Fits Roccia’s strategy for cash-flow-strong, sustainable properties.
column25: Förvärvar fastighet med Willys

column16: Rikshem sold Skrinnaren 1 (11,500 m² building rights) in Hallonbergen, Sundbyberg to Hanssons Hus (H2), which will build ~160 apartments. Construction starts Q2 2026 and completes spring 2028.
column25: Rikshem säljer i Sundbyberg

column16: HP Boende AB acquired building rights of 6,650 m² BTA from Skanska in Södra Änggården, Gothenburg. The project spans 16 floors and will be a residential building.
column25: Skanska säljer byggrätt för höghus

column16: Hines European Property Partners purchased a 10-property industrial/light logistics portfolio totaling 28,000 m² from Areim. The portfolio is 94% leased with 8.4 years average WALT, located in Gothenburg, Stockholm, and Uppsala regions.
column25: Hines köper tio från Areim

column16: Brookfield, in partnership with The Mesh Group, acquired the Unity Living portfolio from Aberdeen & Ailon, marking Brookfield’s first direct investment in Sweden. Portfolio includes 1,300 units (mainly Stockholm & Malmö) plus assets in Finland. Estimated value SEK 1.3 billion. Properties include Påsen 15 (Hammarby Sjöstad), Jylland 1 & Anholt 1 (Kista), and Röshult 1 (Malmö).
column25: Brookfield gör miljardköp i blågul premiär

column16: Hantverkslokaler i Göteborg AB acquired two commercial properties – Katrinehill 6 (6,563 m²) and Maskrosen 17 (2,458 m²)* – totaling 9,021 m² in Bergsäter, Borås. Annual rent income ≈ SEK 4.6 million. Sellers are private owners. Buyer plans long-term ownership and gradual development.
column25: Craft premises buy two in Borås

column16: Klövern purchased Orminge 54:2 in Orminge Centrum, Nacka from Bilia AB and received land allocation for adjacent plots (54:1 and part of 60:1). Plan: ~500 sustainable homes with start in Q1 2029. Project supports Nacka’s urban renewal vision.
column25: Klövern buys from Bilia and invests in 500 homes

column16: Tagehus Holding acquired six fully leased commercial and office properties in central Åre from Diös for SEK 660 million. Annual rent SEK 68m and occupancy 98%. Major tenants include ICA, Coop, Polisen, and Region Jämtland Härjedalen. Transfer 1 Dec 2025. After this, Diös exits Åre completely.
column25: Säljer allt i Åre

column16: Vectura Fastigheter sold AB Näckström, owner of Arsenalsgatan 8 (6,000 m² office) and Villa Täcka Udden (n.a.), to FAM AB for SEK 1.4 billion (incl. inventory). Nordanö advised seller; Savills advised buyer. Closing Q4 2025. The sale streamlines Vectura’s portfolio toward innovation-cluster assets.
column25: Affär för 1,4 miljarder i centrala Stockholm

column16: Svenska Hus sold the leasehold property Emilstorp 1 in Malmö via an off-market transaction to Fastighetsförvaltning Potenza AB. The 7,400 m² property hosts tenants such as OctoFrost Group, Malmö Däck & Bildservice, and Skånes Frukt & Grönt. New Property acted as advisor. Sale aligns with Svenska Hus’ portfolio streamlining; Potenza sees strong potential in the Emilstorp district.
column25: Potenza köper från Svenska Hus

column16: A fully redeveloped office and sports activity property in Kungsbacka has been sold by a private owner to a public real estate company. The 10,259 m² property was renovated between 2020–2023 and houses Jump Yard, M21, and World of Padel as anchor tenants with leases to 2031–2038. New Property advised the seller.
column25: Säljer i Kungsbacka

column16: Svanen Fastigheter acquired 55 modern apartments in Vallastaden, Linköping — marking the company’s first investment in Linköping. The deal strengthens its position in Östergötland. The portfolio consists of sustainable, high-quality residential units between city center and Linköping University.
column25: Gör premiärköp i Linköping

column16: Emilshus purchased five properties in Norrköping, including one development plot, from Mattssons Fastighetsutveckling AB . Fully leased with tenants such as Casall, Café Bar Sverige, and Solar Sverige. Annual rent SEK 19 million; average lease term 3.9 years. Angermann advised the seller.
column25: Emilshus köper i Norrköping för 240 mkr

column16: Pionjären Fastighets AB acquired Norrmejerier’s former dairy property in Luleå (Bergnäset). Norrmejerier will lease parts of the property until end of 2026 during decommissioning. Svefa advised the seller. Pionjären plans to redevelop the industrial site in collaboration with Luleå Municipality into new functional premises and long-term mixed industrial use.
column25: Pionjären köper av Norrmejerier i Luleå

column16: Wihlborgs sold Planteringen 1:8 & 1:9 in southern Helsingborg (Hamncity) to Helsingborgs stad for SEK 41.5 m. The 8,000 m² assets have low occupancy and high maintenance needs but are key to the city’s port and container terminal expansion. Completed 1 Oct 2025.
column25: Wihlborgs buys and sells in Helsingborg

column16: Wihlborgs purchased Snårskogen 2 (2,600 m²) from Bosch Rexroth AB for SEK 26.5 m. The property will be leased to Nomo Industrial Automation AB under a 10-year contract starting Nov 2025. The acquisition complements Wihlborgs’ existing Väla Norra portfolio.
column25: Wihlborgs buys and sells in Helsingborg

column16: Municipal property company Higab acquired Kajskjul 8 and Kajskjul 8½ from sister company Älvstranden Utveckling AB on 1 Oct 2025. The listed waterfront cultural buildings will continue to host events and be preserved as part of Göteborg’s cultural heritage.
column25: Higab has purchased Kajskjul 8 at Packhusplatsen

column16: Two central Stockholm properties, Läraren 9 & 10, sold to another family company for ≈ SEK 280 m (≈ 80 000 SEK/m²). The 3 500 m² assets include apartments, offices and garage space. Yield ≈ 3 %. Sale conducted as a structured share transaction with several competing bids. The rental value was approximately 10.5 million.
column25: Buy two at Norra Bantorget for 80,000 SEK/sq m.

column16: SPG acquired two LSS care properties from Obos in Karlstad and Örebro, each around 500 m², under 15-year leases. The properties are Svanen-certified and part of SPG’s focus on social infrastructure. The transaction aligns with SPG’s strategy to build a SEK 1 billion portfolio within the segment.
column25: SPG acquires two healthcare properties from Obos

column11: Historic preservation and relocation of building
column16: AMF Fastigheter purchased Liljeholmsbadet from Stockholm City with plans to renovate and relocate the iconic 1920s building to Marievik. The project aims to preserve cultural heritage while creating a new public recreation and bath facility. Extensive renovation and structural replacement planned before reopening.
column25: Done: AMF buys Liljeholmsbadet

column5: J L Fastighet i Eskilstuna AB
column16: Tingsvalvet acquired 100% of J L Fastighet i Eskilstuna AB, owner of property Nollplanet 12, for SEK 40.5 million. The 4,036 m² property is fully leased with a yield of approx. 7.5%. Possession on 31 Oct 2025.
column25: The Tingsvåvet in a small acquisition in Eskilstuna

column16: Amaron Commercial Real Estate Fund acquired two commercial properties — Topasen 7 and Beryllen 1 — totaling 7,948 m² in Helsingborg’s Södra Väla industrial area. The deal, financed via equity and bank loans, closes 1 Dec 2025. Part of Amaron’s strategy to expand in the Greater Copenhagen Region.
column25: Amaron acquires 8,000 sq m in Helsingborg

column16: Nivika acquires fully let commercial property Vikvalen 2 (1,700 m²) in Jönköping from GF Fastigheter for 47.5 mSEK. Annual rent ~3.2 mSEK. Transaction partially financed with repurchased B-shares; seller becomes shareholder in Nivika.
column25: Nivika förvärvar för 50 mkr i Jönköping

column10: 33,000 m² housing, 400 m² retail, 1,000 m² preschool
column16: OBOS acquires development rights for Stålklockan 1 & 2 in Norra Djurgårdsstaden from Stockholm city for 906 mSEK. Includes ~320 apartments, preschool, and retail. Handover early 2027 after decontamination; 4-year construction period.
column25: Affär för strax under miljarden inom tullarna

column16: Vättersnäs Förvaltnings acquires historic mixed-use corner property (~3,000 m²) in central Gothenburg from Castellum. Building dates from late 1800s with preserved details. Includes housing, offices, retail & restaurants. Transfer 1 Oct 2025.
column25: Castellum säljer central fastighet

column16: HSB Skåne sells two properties (HQ Sandstenen 1 and adjacent Sandstenen 2) in Lund to a private investor. Part of relocation to new Posthornet offices near Lund C in 2026. Price undisclosed; seller remains as tenant until May 2026.
column25: HSB Skåne säljer två i Lund – HK ingår

column16: Neobo sells Gånsta 2:2 in Enköping (19 townhouse-style buildings, 6,380 m², 97 units) to tenant association Brf Lärkan for 130 mSEK. Sale aligns with external valuation; transfer 1 Oct 2025. Reflects renewed market activity for tenant conversions.
column25: Neobo säljer i Enköping till brf

column16: Balder acquires historic commercial property (1,348 m² over 4 floors) in Gothenburg CBD from Linhultska stiftelsen. Seller bought in 2017 for 70 mSEK. Price not disclosed.
column25: Balder köpt mitt i centrala Göteborg

column16: Neobo sells largely vacant commercial property (1,690 m², only 34 m² leased) in Karlskoga to Karlskogahem for 9 mSEK. Sale in line with external valuation. Transfer 30 Sep 2025.
column25: Neobo sålt i Karlskoga – endast 34 kvm uthyrd

column16: Atrium Ljungberg sells building rights (Kv Stanford 1, Hagastaden) to Besqab for 818 mSEK (~20,000 m² BTA, ~235 units). Record-level pricing (~40,000 SEK/m²). Transfer in 2 stages: Dec 2026 & Aug 2027.
column25: Rekordpris: AL säljer byggrätt inom tull

column16: Trianon acquires 97 apartments (4,536 m², built 1998) in southern Malmö from HSB for 113 mSEK. 51 units leased to Malmö stad. Deal in company form; transfer 1 Oct 2025.
column25: Trianon buys 100 homes in Malmö

column16: JM sells 290-hectare forest property Yxlö 3:1 in Nynäshamn to a private buyer for ~48 mSEK. Non-core asset disposal; closing Q3 2025.
column25: JM sells to private individual in Nynäshamn

column16: Fortinova acquires four newly built residential assets in Strömstad (256 apartments, 9,996 m² + 198 parking) from SPG for 295 mSEK. Fully let, energy class B. Strengthens Fortinova’s portfolio and marks entry into Strömstad market. Transfer 1 Oct 2025.
column25: Fortinova buys for SEK 295 million

column16: Logistri signs LOI with Torngrund to forward fund two logistics properties in Ludvika (103,000 m²) for 1,254 mSEK. 15-year lease signed with Hitachi Energy Sweden. Completion expected early 2027. Yield of 7.1%.
column25: Logistri makes billion-dollar purchase – in Ludvika

column16: Besqab acquires building rights for ~90 new apartments (~8,000 m²) at Paradiset 23, Kungsholmen from Fabege for ~200 mSEK. Project includes demolition of vacant office and new construction with housing, ground-floor retail, garage. Transfer May 2026, production start thereafter.
column25: Besqab köper byggrätter på Kungsholmen för 200 mkr

column16: Stångåstaden acquires Isbjörnen 4 in Lambohovs centrum, Linköping, from Castellum for 36 mSEK. Property includes ~2,600 m² lettable area (400 m² housing + Coop as main tenant). Potential for ~150 new homes as part of district development. Possession Nov 2025.
column25: Stångåstaden köper centrumfastighet av Castellum

column16: Coeli acquires newly built (2020) office and warehouse property in Uppsala, 3,248 m² LOA + 1,188 m² garage. Main tenant Hectronic AB (47% of area). Seller retains car dealership operations via new lease. Possession on 12 Sep 2025.
column25: Coeli gör litet förvärv av nytt i Uppsala

column16: Riksbyggen acquires final plot at Masttorget (Kvarteret Tampen) from Skandia. Plans for ~220 apartments with first phase starting 2027. When complete, Riksbyggen will have delivered ~700 homes in Västra Hamnen.
column25: Riksbyggen köper mark nära Turning Torso

column16: Paulssons acquires historic property (built 1891–1900) in central Lund, 3,151 m² of retail, offices, and apartments. Strengthens company’s position in Lund’s prime shopping area. Transfer scheduled for 1 Oct 2025.
column25: Köper i centrala Lund

column16: Stenhus sells vacant 7,000 m² office development property Vänersnipan 1 in Karlstad to the municipality for 87 mSEK. Disposal improves Stenhus’s occupancy and strengthens cash position; transfer 31 Oct 2025.
column25: Stenhus säljer för 87 mkr till Karlstad kommun

column16: Penthouse in Wallin’s Ersta/25 project (190 m² + 155 m² terrace) sold for 54 mSEK (~284,000 SEK/m²). Project includes 25 condominiums; 23 of 25 units sold. Sotheby’s International Realty brokered the sale.
column25: Penthouse högt på Söder sålt för 284.000 kr/kvm

column16: Nordisk Renting acquires newly built 5,760 m² elderly care home in Borgholm from BJC Group. Sole tenant is Borgholm municipality under long-term lease. Property built 2022–2024, certified Miljöbyggnad Silver, energy class B.
column25: Köper nytt på Öland

column16: Akademiska Hus invests ~500 mSEK in “Mira,” an 8-storey student housing project (9,300 m², 101 apartments for 309 students). Block-leased to Stiftelsen Chalmers Studenthem. Includes ground-floor retail and amenities. Completion expected winter 2027.
column25: AH investerar halv miljard för bostäder i Göteborg

column16: Tenant association acquires Galeasen 1 in Lidingö (26 apartments + 2 commercial units, built 1955) for 75 mSEK. Property has renovation needs (stambyte, bathrooms). Price equates to ~36,000 SEK/m².
column25: Brf tar över för 36.000 kr/kvm på Lidingö

column6: Gothenburg, Mölndal, Huddinge, Norrköping & Västerås (14 properties)
column16: Areim buys 14-property portfolio from Corem for 1,204 MSEK (~72,100 m²; ~92% economic occupancy; rental value 111 MSEK). Mix of office, warehouse/logistics and retail; closing planned for 2025-10-01.
column25: Corem säljer 14 fastigheter till Areim för 1,2 miljarder

column4: JV: Stockholm Skavsta Flygplats AB (50%) & BRA Bygg AB (50%)
column6: Nyköping (Stockholm Skavsta Airport, western terminal area)
column16: JV acquires 540,000 m² land at Skavsta at an underlying value of 200 MSEK; BRA pays 100 MSEK for 50% of the JV (15 MSEK upfront, remainder at legally binding detailed plan). Area borders runways; staged development planned for airport-related uses.
column25: Arlandastad säljer mark för 200 mkr

column16: Coeli RE acquires ~3,000 m² office property Järnplåten 29 in central Stockholm.  Price is estimated at 1,350 MSEK with a yield of 6%. Seller is Floréna Fastigheter. Asset has mixed tenants incl. Svensk Biblioteksförening and Advokatfirman Berglund; some vacancy reported.
column25: Coeli RE köper i city

column16: Kåpan Fastigheter acquires 5,700 m² property (old paper mill, now public use) in Sundsvall from SKIFU for 58 mSEK. Strengthens Kåpan’s position as major landlord for state tenants in the municipality.
column25: Kåpan Fastigheter köper från SKIFU i Sundsvall

column16: Nivika acquires two Varberg assets (2,900 m²) for 40 mSEK via off-market deal. Includes self-storage operations under “Nivika Mitt Lager”. Annual rent ~3.4 mSEK. Payment partly in cash and ~10 mSEK in own B-shares.
column25: Nivika förvärvar i Varberg för 40 miljoner

column16: Hines acquires eight industrial/logistics assets totaling 70,500 m² in Göteborg and Stockholm regions from Mileway. Portfolio ~96% let with tenants incl. Assa Abloy, Pilkington, Dafo Brand and Tesla. Price estimated at 1.3–1.4 bn SEK.
column25: Hines i miljardköp om totalt 70.000 kvm

column16: Nordisk Renting acquires fully let 23,000 m² datacenter in Bromma from Niam. Main tenant is Equinix under a ~14-year lease. Facility recently upgraded with modern infrastructure and positioned as a strategic hub for digital infrastructure. Pricing rumoured 650MSEK with yield slightly below 5%.
column25: Nordisk Renting förvärvar datacenter i Bromma

column16: Stenhus acquires Moga 1:133 for ~295 mkr. Fully let on 20-year triple-net lease to Star Trading AB (Eglo group). Sale-leaseback with a rental value of SEK 24.3M
column25: Stenhus köper för 300 mkr i Svenljunga

column16: SVT Aapro sells two single-tenant industrial properties in Bålsta and Haninge to an institutional investor for 129 mSEK. Both assets are secured by long leases (10 and 5 years) with stable cash flows.
column25: SVT Aapro avyttrar till institutionell investerare | Fastighetsvärlden

column16: CJE Förvaltnings acquires a portfolio in Sigtuna and Knivsta from Arnolds Vingar, including four residential properties, a preschool, and an office (total 3,500 m²). Assets are well maintained with very low vacancy.
column25: Arnolds Vingar säljer till CJE i Sigtuna och Knivsta | Fastighetsvärlden

column16: Kian Properties acquires five residential buildings in Lund from Obos and Balder, totaling 4,173 m² lettable area on 8,134 m² land. Strengthens company’s housing portfolio in southern Sweden.
column25: Kian Properties köper från Obos och Balder | Fastighetsvärlden

column16: Lagerman acquires fully let project property Järngruvan 4 in Botkyrka (7,000 m²), with VGROUP AB as tenant on a 10-year lease. Deal aligns with Lagerman’s strategy to expand in strategic industrial locations in Stockholm county.
column25: Lagerman köper i Botkyrka | Fastighetsvärlden

column6: Multiple cities (Gävle, Falun, Luleå, Umeå, Sandviken, Borlänge, Timrå, Ljusdal, Hudiksvall, etc.)
column16: NP3 acquires 30 properties (mainly food retail & industrial) from Coop Mitt for SEK 685M. Portfolio occupancy ~96%, avg lease term 8 years.
column25: NP3 Fastigheter förvärvar fastigheter för 685 mkr

column16: KAB acquires centrally located residential property with 37 apartments, 4 commercial units, and parking. Attractive location with long-term potential.
column25: KAB köper bostadsfastighet i centrala Göteborg

column16: Tingsvalvet acquires industrial property in Västerås for 76 mkr. Fully let on 15-year triple-net lease, yielding ~8.2%. Indirect share deal.
column25: The Treasury buys for 76 million in Västerås

column16: Private actor divests two logistics properties in Skåne. Stable tenants; strong income streams; Osby building U-shaped (efficient logistics), Bjärnum expanded since 1970s with flexible layout.
column25: Privat aktör sålt två logistikfastigheter i Skåne

column16: The portfolio comprises three fully leased light industrial properties: 1,400 sqm in Malmö, 1,400 sqm in Helsingborg, and an undisclosed area in Habo, totaling around 2,800+ sqm, sold as part of M2 Gruppen’s divestment strategy.
column25: Arnhult säljer tre privata

column16: Built 1908, 15 apartments; sold for conversion to tenant-owned flats; seller retains some space.
column25: Brf köper Lindormen 19 på Östermalm – för 65.000 kr/kvm

column16: Fastighetsstaden acquired 13 central Halmstad properties totaling 27,500 sqm, split between commercial space and 217 residential units. The portfolio includes landmarks like the former Riksbank and Girls’ School, with tenants such as Nordea, Normal, and Dressmann. FV estimates the price at SEK 600–700m with a 4.5% yield.
column25: Fastighetsstaden köper 13 hus i Halmstad

column16: Cobab Sverige AB has sold four light industrial properties in Norrtälje totaling 4,150 sqm lettable area and around 30,000 sqm land to Evolv, with Hyreslandslaget and Wangeskog Hyrcenter as tenants since the properties were built in 2018 and 2022.
column25: Evolv förvärvar lättindustri i Norrtälje från Cobab | Fastighetsvärlden

column16: Offering office, restaurants, and other service functions, the properties located in central Gävle have a leasable area of approximately 4,400 sqm and the annual rental income amounts to about SEK 5M.
column25: Fastpartner gör mindre köp i centrala Gävle

column16: The transaction involves the return of nearly 1,200 rental apartments in Hjulsta to municipal ownership under Familjebostäder, marking a political shift from earlier privatization. The buildings were mainly constructed in the 1970s, except for two high-rises built in 2007.
column25: Einar Mattsson säljer till Familjebostäder för 1,4 mdr

column16: Two outdated industrial buildings will be replaced by modern logistics facilities totaling 40,000 sqm GFA, built to high environmental standards. Construction starts in 2026 and will be phased with leasing.
column25: Southbay och Nrep bildar jv kring logistik

column16: Åkermyntan Centrum in Hässelby Villastad offers 9,500 sqm leasable area. Anchor tenants ICA and Lidl, along with public services, account for over 70% of rental income.
column25: Nordea Liv köper Åkermyntan Centrum

column16: The transaction includes 112 apartments (87 built in 2021, 25 completed in 2025) plus a building right. Properties meet Miljöbyggnad Silver certification, ensuring high technical and environmental standards.
column25: BJC Group AB säljer 112 lägenheter i Kungsbacka

column16: Stenvalvet acquired the 4,000 sqm police station in Kävlinge, recently renovated, strengthening its judiciary property presence in Skåne.
column25: Stenvalvet förvärvar polishuset i Kävlinge

column16: Wåhlin Fastigheter has acquired a leasehold site for a property with three buildings containing 35 rental apartments in Bagarmossen in southern Stockholm. This is the company’s second acquisition in just a few months.
column25: Wåhlin förvärvar flerfamiljshus i södra Stockholm

column16: Peab Bostad has sold 110 rental apartments in Borås’ Regementsstaden to Hökerum Fastigheter, furthering Hökerum’s regional growth and expanding its portfolio to 1,300 homes.
column25: Peab säljer 110 bostäder i Borås till Hökerum

column16: Slättö, through its platform Evolv, has acquired a portfolio of 24 nearly fully let logistics and industrial properties (81,000 sqm lettable area) in key regional cities, primarily leased to established tenants like Bilia and Rejmes on long-term contracts
column25: Slättö förvärvar portfölj med 24 fastigheter | Fastighetsvärlden

column16: Skeppsviken acquires land in Kungsbacka and plans to build 70-100 rentals, preliminary intended for people over the age of 65
